text: Have known this family for many years. What a pleasant surprise when I was visiting my home town and low and behold here was a new store. We live fresh vegetables. Here is the scoop. The McKenzie family has set aside 100 acres that is dedicated to the fresh produce market. The vegetable you will find are what is being grown during the current season. It is picked daily and sold out daily. There is a large variety all grown on the McKenzie produce farm. I have never had a fresher vegetable in my 64 years. Just recently picked up cabbage, Broccoli and Leeks. All picked that day. Man. I could give up meat forever with vegetables this awesome. Thank you McKenzie Family. You are doing an awesome Job!

text:
BEWARE! There are two separate businesses in Green Valley: the market and flowers and the landscaping.  You can judge the flowers for yourself and should get a good quality product.  I would recommend Porters just across the river for a much larger selection.
Now the BEWARE.  I hired Ken Irby to do my landscaping.  His crew did a good job.  As soon as the job was done and the sod laid I was very satisfied.  THEN IT RAINED.  I took pictures of the washed-out sod to the business and showed it to one of the landscapers.  He immediately said they did not put pins in the sod so it washed away.  I then went into the office and showed MR. IRBY.  He said he could fix it for over $1000.
I stated that since it was his workers' error it should not be that much.  He and I agreed to $800 to fix.  I know.  Why should I have to pay anything? As of today, November 4, 2020, I have not gotten responses from e-mails or calls.  I still have a mess and have waited too late to resod because MR. IRBY did not keep his word.  IF YOU DEAL WITH THIS MAN GET IT IN WRITING AS HE IS NOT TO BE TRUSTED.

In response to Mr. Irby.
You try and make yourself look like you will take care of a problem you created. (And charge me $800 to do so).  I REMIND YOU.  I came by your business and left a message, I called you,  left a message, I texted you and you did not contact me at all.(I can send copies)  You had my phone number, email and text and YOU INVITE ME TO CALL YOU.  I HOPE PEOPLE SEE THROUGH YOUR RESONSE THAT YOU WILL TAKE CARE OF us.  Please do not worry about the problem I will take care of it.

resp.text:
Steve,
Happy to get to your home and get this right.
Ken

name: Natalie Gregg
text:
Paid $950 for a job poorly done because I was immediately threatened by the owner Ken Irby that I would be handed over to collections, although before the job was even started he personally told me I didn’t have to pay until I was happy with the job.

First, he made an appointment to install a gravel driveway at our rental house on Monday. He (Green Valley Nursery & Landscape) never showed up that day. I questioned him, & he acted like he was doing me a favor by fitting me into his busy schedule. Told me he’d send a bobcat over to finish the job right then... I asked if the gravel was even at the job site, & he replied, “I have no idea! Guess I better check.” Wow! If that doesn’t tell you how unprofessional they are, I don’t know what does? Said he might be able to get the job done on Tuesday. I finally had him nail down a time for Friday, because I like a guaranteed job when I am paying for it. I felt like I had to babysit them to make sure the job would actually get done. Finally, the driveway was installed by people who are supposedly professionals. They literally just dropped off gravel & spread it out a bit. I’m not a professional landscaper, but all the research we found said that the gravel needed to be plate compacted through the process. He said they don’t do that, & he never promised me that. I only expected him to professionally & properly install a driveway... sorry, that’s what I thought they were. Professionals. Nope. He refused to fix the job, even though I was promised I wouldn’t have to pay until I was happy, & he would make it right. He told me he wanted to wash his hands of me, & wished I’d never bothered him. The gravel in this driveway is so loose that the first rain will wash it all out, it’s uneven, has a poorly graded slope that makes it hard to enter the drive without scraping the bottom of your car, & my husband couldn’t fit his Jeep in the carport anymore because there was so much gravel under it. They refused to fix it at the present cost, & said they would plate compact it for another $500. He said, “I’ll bill you, don’t pay it, & I’ll send you to collections. We’ll let the law handle it.” Unbelievable & awful experience. My husband & I could’ve done this job properly for as little as $700, but we decided to hire “pros” instead, & now, we are out $950, & it’s not even done right... meaning more expenses for us now. Do your research before hiring Ken Irby.

I used to go to Big B a lot, we lived close and it was easier than going to Walmart, plus their prices were wonderful.
Then things got worse, our selections became spoiled meat that was repackaged and called "fresh" you could smell it was not, several times we bought packaged veggies at a deal and found mold. Most of their dairy is past it's date but they wash them off so there are no dates and then tell you, "you can either buy it or go somewhere else".
So now we drive to town to buy our stuff or go next door to Dollar General, because we know their stuff isn't rotten or expired. Also when looking up the health score online it doesn't show that Big B has a current health department rating, this is alarming on so many levels.

HI Randi
i am sorry that happen to you but please let me know next time when you here because our employee  is not allowed to smoke by the door  but designated smoking area and we have only two employee who smokes  but i have not catch them smoking by the door but please let me know while you are here

name: Landon Bragg
text: This used to be a great place to shop. They had decent prices on good quality meats, fresh produce, and friendly staff. I took my last trip out to Big B's today (10/10/18) only to find they'd closed an hour and a half early. They cover expiration dates with "sale" stickers, chop expired produce in "stir fry" mixes, and leave a ton of fat face down on meats seemingly to increase weight. I can't count the number of times I've seen expired dairy or milk here. Pic'N Sav in Oxford or Anniston both sells the same generic products, but at much lower prices. It just doesn't make sense why the owner would be okay with running a store this way.  Save yourself the hastle and shop somewhere else.

name: AKK
text:
Over the course of 2019 I have been able to purchase blue corn grits, yellow grits, yellow cornmeal, rolled oats, flax seeds and polenta from McEwen & Sons.

My first order was in February in my last semester of getting my bachelor's degree. At that time I had no time to spend on thinking about meal planning and no money to go out to eat (and not willing to eat ramen), so I decided to take a gamble on a 10lb bag of blue grits instead.

Since then, McEwen & Sons grains have been a fairly large staple of my diet.
At this point, I am mostly gluten free, and not even by conscious decision. The way corn or oatmeal fills up your stomach feels entirely different from the way bread or pasta does - and never have I felt physically ill or lethargic from making and eating a little too much (many?) grits.

For a month or two, I found a local supermarket that offered grits in bulk and thought I'd switch, but despite my attempts to add spices and such they didn't taste like much of anything (they weren't organic and definitely hadn't been refrigerated).
Making cornbread using the recipe on the bag was also wonderful! And very easy to make and pack, though is always best straight out of the oven or with soup.

For anyone trying to eat healthy on a budget - or really anyone who enjoys tasting food at all - I very much recommend McEwen & Sons.

They offer free ground shipping on all orders over $75, which I try to take advantage of, as it's usually around $25 of shipping that I can now spend on provisions instead.

Additionally any orders over $40 include a free gift!
Once it was yellow cornmeal, which got me hooked on that. This most recent order included blue cornmeal, which I haven't tried yet but am very much looking forward to making blue cornbread with).

Current favorite recipe:
1.In a cast iron pan, cover some garlic and shallots with oil/butter/lard and roast in your oven until crispy.
2. Add some grits or cornmeal to boiling water
3. cook on low, stirring until thick.
4. Add chipotle, garlic and shallots, hatch green chile, some buttermilk, coriander, spinach etc.
5. Enjoy

A very long review, but I'm spending Christmas morning alone this year and thought I should give something to somebody this morning.

So long and thanks for all the grits,

AKK

I was a big fan of this place when they were 24 hours. Now i prefer krogers. They open at 7 and close at ~8-10. Between the oblivious patrons blocking the path, the 'buy me' displays everywhere and the daytime stocking carts it's very frustrating just to move around in the store. There is no room. This isn't the employee's fault as employee's aren't displays or stocking carts. This is a managerial fault. Have daytime stocking or 'buy me' displays. Don't clutter the aisles with both. If I had to sum up my review it's just 'store very cluttered'.

I don't have the same frustrations moving around in other grocery stores. This is a walmart specific problem.

I was shopping last night and, out of the blue as is soooooo common with severe vertigo, I went into a panic attack and was almost in tears as I raced to the front of the store to check out and leave, and that sweet girl immediately noticed something was wrong.  I told her I was just trying to check out quickly because I was on the verge of a severe panic attack, and she raced around to me and put her arms around me and spoke the sweetest, kindest words, and I knew she was a gift straight from God!!  She checked me out and had me take a seat on the bench right up front and across from her checkout line, and just kept talking to me in between her other customers.  GIVE THAT GIRL A PROMOTION AND A RAISE!!

I love the pick up service, even in the rain they greeted me, insisted I stay in car, and marked the fragile items like bread and eggs. I am impressed with this store and the associates that work at the Neighborhood Market. I can't say enough to relay how great this store and how happy they are in our community.
